title: John Newton Johnson to Walt Whitman, 10 May 1875
text: Meltonsville, AlabamaMay 10 1875.Walt Whitman Dear Friend—Yours dated came to afternoon—contents safe.What you a variety of thoughts. I have long enthusibility an indispensible foundation heroic life. Besides numerous other "good" as almost everybody else would call them, I have in my mind the instance of my first wife an girl whom I became acquainted with at a school I attended in my 15th year, and married when I was just 18 yrsyears & 2 days old—(mind you! I had no father, mother, sister, and but one nude, repellent brother and his wife a good match for him.) Now, that girl of mine for 10 years was the purest, gentlest, and generally the most cheerfully amiable person that could be imagined—I "fairly" worshipped her from beginning to end, and was perhaps as happy in marriage with her as a man could possibly be Yet she had that fault—I don't got or could get the thought into her head—she appeared pervious to the of enthusiasm indeed my life with her was somewhat painful, as be sure that with my extreme or fastidiousness in the business of could keep her really contented with ing my principles. When it became necessary in order to retain my home that reconstruct my family, I preferred to be content with less of amiability if I could secure more strength or vitality. I thought it would be too great a task to hunt the world over for a perfect match. The present Mrs "Philosopher" is not destitute of various desirable qualities—she is very "shrewd," and too nice a housekeeper—Yet she is another one of the sort not enthusible. Perhaps you have noticed that I could have sent you some considerable "heart-offering" without trying to be able to justify myself by knowing you to be in absolute want Mrs. Philosopher can't rule me, and rule her! If you should wish to know than from myself whether I am "good enough" man, please that there is means by which you explain who the oldest resident prominent merchants, lawyers this country.Modesty and at the thought of the answers for leading questions about , self sacrifice of pecuniary one hand or devotion to ideas of righteous opposition to a world on the other—also of father, uncle and cousins. (Probably you would not give a "fig" for more evidence.) I find myself nothing like so happy a man as I was before the war—yet my property losses never troubled me "one bit", and few of my near relatives lost their lives or otherwise badly "hurt". I have come to have a poorer digestion, and have met up with so many petty "classes" from the insignificance of the moral strength of "people" as experience enlarges that I suppose to be chief cause repression. I find however a sort a change of belief about question—when I thought direct work of a "Creator" help being angry with Him making of mean souls. Also when I could have a belief Free Will I more than think I shall be looking upon souls as material Free Will as the product of "Antecedents".(Please let us not waste time or life by arguing upon any points of difference in our opinions on any subject—I dont ask any long letters from you—only a card sometimes to tell of your health and happiness—There is not much political difference—with a white-hot temper or heart I unite a wonderfully thoughtful cool, methodical character and habit of mind—I am no bigot (couldn't possibly be so)—would prove a great listener for you if I could be with you ☞ "baby" has ordered you to talk and tied. Crop work progressing well friend! been up bravely—you cause must to the end magnificent FAME in the future people in my country know what heroism means.> JNJ P.S. I am a ground is too wet to plow—after one day's work I see friend—I believe I will "kill" the mill and one stone" to-day—Monday May 10 John Newton Johnson to Walt Whitman, 10 May 1875
